paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: heart failure with preserved ejection fraction

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Once symptomatic, Val122Ile carriers with heart failure have a worse prognosis than those with WT cardiac amyloid, with a median survival of just over two years.
Once symptomatic, Val122Ile carriers with heart failure have a worse prognosis than those with WT cardiac amyloid, with a median survival of just over two years.
This allele appears to confer a significant risk for the development of heart failure.
This allele appears to confer a significant risk for the development of heart failure.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile mutation destabilizes the TTR tetramer, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in African American populations.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is associated with predominantly cardiac involvement.
key_quotes: The frequency of Val122Ile in populations with heart failure remains largely unknown.
In another case control study of asymptomatic Val122Ile carriers, this allele appears to confer a significant risk for the development of heart failure.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
